content.description:
The original post of this route has a good description. I’m posting it as an actual route, because I feel it deserves it. Anyone have the history on this? Grade check?

 Start on small crimps and little feet. Move straight up through little edges. There’s a great finish on a nice edge and bomber pinch over the lip. This may have a different name. It is an old route that’s probably in some old timer's climbing journal.
content.protection: A pad. Watch out for old, rusted hangers. Maybe it’s best to remove them? You could get caught on them if you miss the lip. I would not trust the bolts for roping up.
content.location: It is the only route with bolts.

content.description: Climb the tall face with nice cracks and mellow climbing. Start standing, move up along some features to the deep, horizontal crack. From there, move through the two vertical cracks to the top.
content.location: It is left of Indian Headress.

content.description: Start with your right hand on a crimp, your left on the crack feature, and with good feet. Layback on nice holds until you can gain the crescent-shaped, deep edge. Match. Gain the lip, and top out.
content.protection: A pad. Watch the tree while laying back.
content.location: This is the best route farthest left of what’s out there.

content.description: This has a route that someone bolted a very long time ago. The bolts definitely are not usable anymore, but no rope is necessary.  This has a very fun problem though that has small edges and a very sketchy top out that invokes a weird scramble thing to get out of.
